name: Tony Christie
description: '''Anthony Fitzgerald''' (born 25 April 1943), known professionally as '''Tony Christie''', is an English musician and singer. He found prominence in the early 1970s with successful singles including "[[Las Vegas (Tony Christie song)|Las Vegas]]", "[[I Did What I Did for Maria]]" and "[[Avenues and Alleyways]]". In 2005, he achieved a UK number 1 album and single after his 1971 hit of "[[(Is This the Way to) Amarillo]]" was reissued in aid of [[Comic Relief]].
